item.title: Flytipped electrical items, 1st August
item.description:
Hello. Someone has left three electrical items outside my front gate (2 electric heaters and an iron). This happened during the night on 31 July / in the early hours of 1 August. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Foxgrove Avenue, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blakeney road is littered with rubbish, broken glass and detritus. The berms when mowed go over the rubbish without removing it beforehand, so it’s further dispersed., 1st August
item.description:
The whole street is a rubbish dump, there is a huge amount of broken glass which never gets cleaned up, the people who mow the berms, mow over it. There’s are cans and rubbish everywhere. I don’t know if it’s the rubbish collectors dropping the rubbish or people leaving rubbish, whatever it is, it’s appalling, we all pay council tax and need clean and safe streets. There is only one rubbish bin on this street which probably exacerbates the issue. It needs to be seriously cleaned up, sweep all the glass up and junk. It’s been like this since I moved her in Sept 2024.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blakeney Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More of the same with commercial waste added, 1st August
item.description:
The first 2 photos are the afternoon immediately after bin/recycling collection The 3rd photo shows the mass that has collected since. The pile includes cardboard from the local take away / restaurant which has no problem dumping their commercial waste This area was supposed to be monitored Not sure what kind of monitoring this is

item.title: Overgrown tree, 1st August
item.description:
Hi. I live in London Road SE23 3XW. We have huge very overgrown abandoned trees that need pruning. I'm very concerned the fact that no one s taking responsibility for this. On the council website says it’s tfl responsibility, on tfls website it says it’s not their responsibility but fix my street. How can such a huge tree be no one’s responsibility? I have seen my neighbours reporting these tree problems as the roots are breaking the front gardens of our property and the buses are getting hit with the branches and also the tree is so big it's more than half way through the street. But tfl doesn't want to deal with it it says you can help ? I'm extremely concerned therefore you my council I hope can get in touch with the right department and advise who is meant to deal with this before someone gets hurt

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 100, London Road, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
